Dear [Patient's Name],

We are writing to provide a summary of your recent hospital stay from March 10, 2024, to March 20, 2024. During this time, you were under our care following an incident that required medical intervention.

Upon your admission on March 10, 2024, you experienced a fall resulting in a temporary loss of consciousness. Initial evaluations included a CT scan, conducted on March 11, 2024, which identified a hemorrhagic stroke in the right hemisphere of your brain. This finding confirmed the diagnosis of an intracerebral hemorrhage, which we understand has caused significant concern.

Your laboratory tests from March 11, 2024, reported a slightly low hemoglobin level and an elevated white blood cell count, indicating some underlying issues that needed addressing. Additionally, a coagulation profile showed an elevated INR, suggesting your bleeding time was prolonged, a factor we continually monitored during your stay.

In response to your condition, we commenced treatment with Mannitol at a dosage of 0.25 g/kg every six hours to manage cerebral edema and utilized antihypertensives as needed to maintain your blood pressure within a safe range.

Throughout your stay, our team closely monitored your neurological status. Despite our efforts, including initiating safety measures to prevent further falls, there was no significant improvement in your condition as observed in repeated assessments that noted continued slurred speech, right-sided weakness, and a Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) score of 11.

We had several discussions with your family regarding your prognosis and ongoing care needs. It's crucial to have a support system in place for your recovery and to ensure you receive the necessary care upon your expected discharge.

Please remain in contact with your primary care physician and any specialists involved in your continued care. Should you experience any changes in your condition or have any concerns, do not hesitate to reach out to them promptly.

We appreciate your trust in our team and wish you a smooth path to recovery.

Sincerely,
